name: webmin
description: Webmin is a self-hosted web-based interface for administering Unix-like systems. It provides modules for managing services, users, DNS, and more through a browser instead of command line alone.

features.title: Web Interface
features.description: Manage Unix/Linux servers through a web interface without command-line access

features.title: User Management
features.description: Create, modify, and delete system users and groups with password and permission controls

features.title: File Upload
features.description: Browse, edit, upload, and download files with a built-in file manager and text editor

features.title: Package Management
features.description: Install, update, and remove software packages using your distribution's package manager

features.title: Disk Management
features.description: Partition disks, create filesystems, manage RAID arrays, and monitor disk usage

features.title: Database Backup
features.description: Set up automated backups of files, databases, and system configurations
